Getting Started

  • Getting Started
  • Webinar Signup
  • FAQ
  • Knowledge Base
  • API Documentation
  • Blog

Start testing your website with Optimizely today

Get up and running with these five simple steps

  • Step 1: Enter your URL on Optimizely.com

    Simply type your website's URL into the field on the homepage or below and click "Test it Out." Your webpage will immediately load into Optimizely's visual editor, ready for optimization.

    Next: Add page variations »

  • Step 2: Add page variations

    Change elements on the page using Optimizely's powerful visual editor and easily set up tests on promotions, pricing, sale text, banners, colors and much more in mere seconds.

    Next: Set up goals for tracking »

  • Step 3: Set up goals for tracking

    Measure clicks, conversions, engagement, revenue or virtually any other custom goal for any page on your site.

    Next: Set targeting conditions and allocate traffic »

  • Step 4: Target and allocate

    Easily target a test to specific audiences like new versus returning visitors, specific geographies, and more—a virtually endless range of custom targeting.

    Next: Launch your experiment »

  • Step 5: Launch, watch, and assess

    Real-time results and reporting will show your test performance and let you know when your test reaches statistical significance. From there, implement your changes with confidence.

1 2 3 4 5

Getting Started FAQ

How do I implement the Optimizely snippet?

Implementing the Optimizely snippet is as easy as a one-time copy and paste of your unique, single line of javascript into your page's html header. Watch the quick walkthrough video.

How do I build my first experiment?

To build an experiment, load the URL of the page you'd like to test in the Optimizely editor. From there, you can build your page variations using the visual editor and launch your experiment. Watch the overview video.

What should I test with Optimizely?

While there is no magic bullet for what to test that can guarantee a positive result, there are several guiding principles that can help you build out your testing itinerary. The best place to start is with the end in mind. Consider your goals and objectives for a particular page, and utilize analytics to key in on areas for possible improvement. For a great way to jumpstart the development of your testing plan, you can watch our Best Practices and Lessons Learned overview, which aims to share our key takeaways from tens of thousands of Optimizely tests.
